thig14.1:0.3: Verses of the Elder Subhā of Jīvaka’s Mango Grove
thig14.1:1.4: so Subhā said this to him:
thig14.1:2.1: "Have I done something to offend you,
thig14.1:2.2: that you stand there holding me back?
thig14.1:2.3: Because it is not proper, friend,
thig14.1:2.4: for a layperson to touch one who has gone forth.
thig14.1:3.1: This is serious, according to my teacher's instructions.
thig14.1:3.2: There are trainings which have been expounded by the one faring well.
thig14.1:3.3: I am on the path of complete purity, I am flawless,
thig14.1:3.4: why do you stand there holding me back?
thig14.1:4.1: Your mind is turbulent, mine is not,
thig14.1:4.2: your mind is dirty, mine is not,
thig14.1:4.3: My mind is flawless and liberated everywhere,
thig14.1:4.4: why do you stand there holding me back?"
thig14.1:5.2: what can going forth do for you?
thig14.1:5.4: come enjoy yourself in this flowering forest.
thig14.1:6.3: early Spring is a pleasant season,
thig14.1:6.4: come, we will delight in this flowering forest.
thig14.1:7.2: rustle as they are moved by the wind.
thig14.1:7.4: if you descend into the forest alone?
thig14.1:8.1: Encircled by a multitude of beasts and snakes,
thig14.1:8.3: You want to go without a companion
thig14.1:8.4: into this lonely, dreadful, and immense forest?
thig14.1:9.1: A doll made of shining gold,
thig14.1:9.2: like a nymph amongst beautiful vines.
thig14.1:9.3: Wearing the finest linen from Kāsi,
thig14.1:9.4: you will be radiant; with such good clothing, there will be none like you.
thig14.1:10.1: I would be under your control,
thig14.1:10.2: if we live together in the forest
thig14.1:10.3: because there is no one more dear than you,
thig14.1:10.4: a creature with the soft eyes of a dryad.
thig14.1:11.1: If you were to pronounce the words:
thig14.1:11.2: 'Come, let's live a pleasant household life!'
thig14.1:11.4: you will have women attending you.
thig14.1:12.1: Wearing the finest linen from Kāsi,
thig14.1:12.2: you can wear garlands and makeup
thig14.1:12.4: with lots of gold, jewels, and pearls.
thig14.1:13.1: A beautiful blanket, freshly washed and dyed,
thig14.1:13.2: on a brand-new mattress upholstered with wool.
thig14.1:13.3: You can get on that fabulous bed,
thig14.1:13.4: scented with the essence of sandalwood.
thig14.1:14.1: Like a blue lotus that has risen up from the water
thig14.1:14.2: But is not used by any person
thig14.1:14.3: in the same way, if you live the holy life,
thig14.1:14.4: your hair and limbs will wither away."
thig14.1:15.1: "What do you consider of value here,
thig14.1:15.2: in this carcass - full of corpses,
thig14.1:15.3: bound for the cemetery, destined to break apart?
thig14.1:15.4: What have you seen that makes you so deranged?"
thig14.1:17.1: Your eyes are like the crest of a blue lotus,
thig14.1:17.2: in a face that shines like pure gold.
thig14.1:18.1: Even when we are far apart,
thig14.1:18.2: I will remember your long lashes and pure eyes,
thig14.1:18.3: because there is no one more dear than you,
thig14.1:18.4: with the soft eyes of a dryad."
thig14.1:19.1: "You want to walk where there is no path,
thig14.1:19.2: you seek the moon like it were a toy.
thig14.1:19.3: You want to jump over Mount Meru,
thig14.1:19.4: you chase after a disciple of the Buddha.
thig14.1:20.1: There is nothing in this world, even with all its devas
thig14.1:20.2: which I could now have lust for.
thig14.1:20.3: What is it like? I do not know,
thig14.1:20.4: since it has been completely uprooted by the path.
thig14.1:21.2: destroyed like a bowl of poison deserves.
thig14.1:21.3: What is it like? I do not see,
thig14.1:21.4: since it has been completely uprooted by the path.
thig14.1:22.2: or has not been close to the Teacher,
thig14.1:22.4: but I am one who knows, so you are wasting your time here.
thig14.1:23.1: Whether I am reviled or respected,
thig14.1:23.2: whether there is pleasure or pain, mindfulness is established.
thig14.1:23.3: Knowing that conditioned things are not beautiful,
thig14.1:24.1: I am a female disciple of the one faring well,
thig14.1:24.2: I travel with the Eightfold Path as my vehicle.
thig14.1:24.3: Free from corruptions, with darts removed,
thig14.1:24.4: I enjoy being in an empty dwelling.
thig14.1:25.3: with sticks and strings they are bound
thig14.1:25.4: like a group of little dancers.
thig14.1:26.1: But when those sticks and strings are pulled out,
thig14.1:26.2: when it is untied, non-functional, splayed out,
thig14.1:26.3: one could not find anything in its parts
thig14.1:26.4: so where could the mind settle?
thig14.1:27.2: they do not move without those qualities,
thig14.1:27.3: since it does not move without those qualities,
thig14.1:28.1: Like when you have seen a painting on a wall
thig14.1:28.3: and your vision of it is distorted,
thig14.1:28.4: perceptions existing in the human world are useless. (perceiving it as human is meaningless - SD).
thig14.1:29.1: It is like a supreme illusion,
thig14.1:29.2: like a golden tree in a dream.
thig14.1:29.3: Blind one, you are pursuing something as meaningless
thig14.1:29.4: as a marionette amidst a group of people.
thig14.1:31.1: She pulled out that charming eye,
thig14.1:31.2: with a mind of non-attachment, she said:
thig14.1:31.4: and she gave it to that man.
thig14.1:32.1: In that moment his lust dissipated,
thig14.1:32.3: "May you be well living the holy life,
thig14.1:33.2: is like embracing a blazing fire,
thig14.1:33.3: or picking up a poisonous snake,
thig14.1:33.4: May you be well, forgive me."
thig14.1:34.1: The Bhikkhunī was let go, and from there
thig14.1:34.2: she went to the excellent Buddha,
thig14.1:34.3: seeing the characteristic of excellent merit,
thig14.1:35.2: The Elder Subhā of Jīvaka’s Mango Grove
thig14.1:36.1: The Chapter of the Thirties is finished.
